channel.title: Is RuneScape Educational?
channel.description:
I have learned quite a few things from Runescape. Granted, most of it is trivial, such as what obsidian is,but some of it has actually taught me some good habits. Time management, saving money, many "lessons" such as these can be learnt by playing Runescape. That being said, I have met others who say that Runescape actually works against your education. They say you lose time to study and procrastinated in order to play, among other arguments. So I ask you, is Runescape educational, or just a hinderance?
Discuss.

item.title: Is RuneScape Educational?
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:79, topic:410151”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=511434.msg3729878#msg3729878 date=1314555070]

Positive:
You guys believe it or not, i learned my typing skills from playing so much damn runescape growing up, I can type around 128wpm.

Negative:
Common spelling errors, most of my grammar is based off of runescape now sadly enough, instead of saying:
Armor I say armour.
Defense, i spell defence.

I also spell them armour and defence. Bad habit I suppose.
[/quote]

Wait , defence is BE and defense is AE?
<.<[/quote]
Like Colour and Color.
Armor and Armour
Grey and Gray

Read full topic

item.title: Is RuneScape Educational?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“TheHolyGrail, post:69, topic:410151”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=511434.msg3723039#msg3723039 date=1314070539]
There is a lot of accurate things. Did you know that most trees are simply known as “tree”? And idiot can cut one down.

But seriously though, oak, willow, maple, teak, yew.

Copper, tin, coal, iron, granite

Bronze, iron steel

So many plants… wont go into farming.

Agility is just your parkour level

Archery skill I guess…

Shrimp, salmon, tuna, trout, bass, swordfish, shark, the list goes on.

Jagex doesn’t have to many unnatural substances when it comes to their natural resources.
[/quote]My neighbor wears black armour. :|[/quote]

Let’s not be Racist.

I learned alot of things from everyday things. Not just Runescape. You know that chant cheerleaders do “F-I-G-H-T You gotta fight fight fight for Victory”. Learned how to spell Eight from that and got a 4 on my First Grade spelling test. Runescape helped me with the female sheep, called a ewe, pronounced “yew”. Got an A on my fifth grade oral exam.

Read full topic

A very interesting topic, and oddly correct.

Just a couple of off my head

-I know a lot more about ores of today and when combined what is the general result
-I now know what a tinderbox was(never thought about the word “tinder” before lol)
-Many great lores in the game if you quest that you come to realize are also in real life such as tales of dragons.

item.title: Is RuneScape Educational?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_L Mod L
item.description:
@Mod_L wrote:

Rs is educational. when i was younger it made my english grammar qiute better, i started getting better grades in english. i also learned basic stuff Tin+cooper=bronze metal, coal+iron ores=steel… i also learned what fish are caught with a rod,harpoon,big net etc… the treasure trail puzzles=educational.
It is Educational but is not adviced to take up your social life. Playing it too long will mean that your social life will be affected as you would rather play RuneScape instead of going out with mates. It teaches people how to manage money and make decisions. It is great for socialism and it helps improve typing skills. It mainly teaches the market and how prices and shares increase and drop. 75% of the game has to do with mathematical, social, and arithmetic puzzles whereas the other 25% is fantasy and player vs player action.

so yeah runescape if educational if you play with normal time portions that would not take over your social life ;]

Read full topic

I learned how to Wind Strike.

Jagex actually got sued because some kid lost his life to Runescape.

[/quote]

How? People kill themselves over pixels…?[/quote]
It was on the news in the US. He didn’t leave his room for like 20 hours and didn’t eat or drink.
Another person then said he was going to kill himself, and the police showed up and he had to spend a night or two in jail for wasting police time.
